alert.note: Alert for Huntingdon (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 1:11AM EST until January 11 at 2:08AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a Flood Warning for the following creeks in Pennsylvania... Aughwick Creek at Shirleysburg affecting Huntingdon County. For the Aughwick Creek...including Shirleysburg...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Aughwick Creek at Shirleysburg. * WHEN...Until just after midnight Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Aughwick Creek at Shirleysburg exceeds its banks. Several homes are affected. At 12.0 feet, Flood waters from Aughwick Creek cover portions of Gilbo Road, Aughwick Mills Road and Keystone Road in Shirley Township. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 8.9 feet. - Forecast...The creek is expected to rise above flood stage during the predawn hours to a crest of 11.1 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tonight. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued later tonight.
